--- title: "Lesson 2: Reading Data" toc: true --- ## Looking At Datasets Options to See Data: - `view()`: this opens a new tab to view the data in a spreadsheet style like Excel - `head()`: this returns the top six rows of a dataset, or the "head" of the data Examples of this are in the section below.
## Build-in Datasets Run this code to see a list of built in datasets: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data() ``` ::: The `iris` dataset is built into R. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} view(iris) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} head(iris) ``` :::
## Reading Data from URL Read in this dataset from this URL: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saundersg/Statistics-Notebook/master/Data/Rent.csv ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} housing_data <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saundersg/Statistics-Notebook/master/Data/Rent.csv") head(housing_data) ``` :::
## Reading Data from Local CSV File ::: {.cell} ::: # Other Topics: - directories - running code
